result.execSummary:
The defendant David Ward Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 104 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers. No alcohol or controlled substances.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Restitution set at zero. Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Ward Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (51 pages) commencing 06/06/2014 DOCTOR'S REPORT RETURN PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Original Transcript STATUS CONFERENCE (32 pages) commencing APRIL 9, 2014 received and filed.

Invoice dated: 05-30-2014
Invoice forwarded to A/P on 07-01-2014 in the amount of $562.50 to Dr. Collins for services on 04/30, 05/01, 05/06/2014. 
COPY IN FILE. sdg

Defendant David Ward in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant David Ward in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties stipulate to the Doctor's Report. Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Darryl W.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 104 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Dr. Pankiewicz Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified for pick up.

Defendant David Ward in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant David Ward in custody.  Karyn E Behling on behalf of Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 15. Case set for return on doctor's report and plea and sentencing. Court reviewed the doctor's report with the parties. Defense counsel requests the ability to reserve challenges until after a competency evaluation is completed. Court denies defense counsel's request. State and defense do not contest the findings of the doctor. Court accepts the opinions of Dr. Collins and finds there is no support for an NGI plea. Court is advised by the defense and by Dr. Collins' report there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court recommends Dr. Collins complete the competency evaluation due to prior completion of the NGI report. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's Report received and filed. sab

Attorney Christian T Eichenlaub in court, defendant David Ward not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
NO COURT FILE.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Case remains on the calendr for Docotr's Report return on 5/8/2014.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL received and filed

Defendant David Ward in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant David Ward in custody. Karyn Behling for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defense counsel feels the defendant may have reason for a not guilty by mental disease or defect plea. Court ordered the defendant examined pursuant to Wis Stat 971.16. Case calendared for Return of Doctors Report on 5/8/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant David Ward in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant David Ward in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail amended to $5000.00 cash. All other conditions remain. Case remains on the calendar for Plea/Sentencing on 4/21/2014.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant David Ward in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant David Ward in custody.  Step Nolten for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and E;ectronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Ward in court with attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Defendant David Ward in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
